result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. ROCKLEWITZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with Christopher Loucks, Brittany Ramon, Taylor Baxter, Bruce Suettinger, Manitowoc Walmart, Manitowoc Walgreens, Charles Adams, Tany Pivonka-Dewane and contact with Lauren Free will be as directed by the agent;

Provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, consecutive to the straight jail setnence imposed on 15 CM 302.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Michael W. ROCKLEWITZ
Current: 1025 South 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 01-26-2022)
Prior: 1025 S. 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States
Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was discharged from probation effective 03-03-22.
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue
Order/Judgment for Restitution and for Court Ordered Financial Obligations.
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing

Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing; Order Extending Probation ordering that defendant's probation be extended for a period of one (1) month or until all court obligations are completed. New discharge date of 03-03-22.  If payment structure (plan)( is not provided to Probation and Parole and/or court prior to 03-03-22 for repayment of remaining restitution and court costs, the court will not extend probation for a period of six (6) months without further hearing or order of this court.
Duplicate original delivered to DOC.
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing.
Letter from defendant to Judge Rohrer.

1:38 PM Defendant Michael W. ROCKLEWITZ appeared in court, Probation & Parole Agent Sarina Hoffman in person in court.  State of Wisconsin not in court.  Court goes over the facts of the case. Probation was looking to extend the Defendant's probation, which expires 2/4/2022, for purposes of paying restitution in full.  Court goes over his rights.  Probation informs the Court that, given new information,  it is now requesting Defendant be discharged from supervision and asks the Court to convert restitution to a civil judgment.  Off the record at 1:43 PM.  On the record at 1:45 PM.  Court talks with the parties.  Court orders probation to be amended to March 3, 2022.  In that time, Defendant is ordered to come up with a plan to pay restitution without supervision.  If a plan is not in place by March 3, 2022, the Court will extend the term of probation for an additional 6 months.  Probation & Parole to prepare the amended Order from the current extension date to March 3, 2022.
Ext. supervision conditions modification hearing on February 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Plea date at 02-04-2016 02:30 pm
Settlement conference at 12-18-2015 03:15 pm

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.   Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 08-18-15 at 9:00 a.m.   Plea date is set for 11-20-15 at 9:30 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection.   
Minutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, Public Defender.

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 07-08-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Affidavit of Lt. Andrew Colborn, Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of burglary, theft and 4 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-29-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Bruce Suettinger, except as to court proceedings, or the residsence of 6201 County Highway O, Two Rivers, WI.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
RE:  Bruce Suettinger, on 06-21-15.

Search warrant issued.  RE:  2309 13th Street, Two Rivers, WI occupied by Michael Rocklewitz.
Search warrant with return of officer thereon.
